Computer Parts

Cases

Computer cases have form factors, such as ATX, ITX, Mini ATX, and Mini ITX. Computer cases contain all of the computer parts, and are generally made out of plastic and metal. The size of the case varies depending on the form factor, which decides what kind of parts can fit in it, because other parts like the power supply also have a form factor. There also needs to be some kind of cooling system inside the computer case.

fun fact 1
AMD stands for Advanced Micro Devices.

fun fact 2
Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975, and started off in Albuquerque, New Mexico, United States.

fun fact 3
Apple was founded on April 1, 1976, and started off in Cupertino, California, United States.
